In the field of genetics, what does the term "pleiotropy" refer to?
A. A single gene that influences multiple, seemingly unrelated phenotypic traits
B. The occurrence of one gene suppressing the effect of a second gene
C. The ability of a gene to have multiple alleles
D. The interaction of two or more genes to produce a certain trait
A. A single gene that influences multiple, seemingly unrelated phenotypic traits
